doc:
Phyllis Allen https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phyllis_Allen 0 Phyllis Allen (November 25, 1861 – March 26, 1938) was an American vaudeville and silent screen comedian who worked with Charles Chaplin, Mabel Normand, Roscoe "Fatty" Arbuckle, and Mack Sennett during a film career spanning 74 movies in the decade between 1913 and 1923. Due to her imposing demeanour and perennially haughty expression, she was quite similar in appearance to fellow screen comedian Marie Dressler. Phyllis_Allen ( November_25_,_1861 – March_26_,_1938 ) was an_American_vaudeville and silent_screen_comedian who worked with Charles_Chaplin , Mabel_Normand , Roscoe_"_Fatty_"_Arbuckle , and Mack_Sennett during a_film_career spanning 74_movies in the_decade between 1913_and_1923 . Due to her_imposing_demeanour and perennially_haughty_expression , she was quite_similar in appearance to fellow_screen_comedian_Marie_Dressler .
